Explanations about Options.-data(C): Please replace "/dev/sr1" with the device identifier of your target drive (find out what it is with "inxi -d"), and replace "myiso" with your iso and its disk location if necessary. .   "wodim -eject -tao speed=2 dev=/dev/sr1 -v -data myiso.iso" .  "growisofs -dvd-compat -Z /dev/sr1=myiso.iso".
Explanations about Options.-data(M):
is the default , if no other flag is present and the file does not appear to
 be of one of the well known audio file types.
Explanations about Options.-tao(M):
Set TAO (Track At Once) writing mode. This is the default write mode in previous
 wodim versions. With most drives, this write mode is required for multi session
 recording.

Answers.MP Summary: write data to optical disk media

Explanations about Options.-r(M): This option specifies that the drive should be ejected using a CDROM eject command.
Explanations about Options.-t(M):
With this option the drive is given a CD-ROM tray close command. Not all devices
 support this command.

for i in {1..20}; do
    eject /dev/dvd
    read -p 'Insert disc and press RETURN: '
    eject -t /dev/dvd
    growisofs -Z /dev/dvd=saved.iso
done
eject /dev/dvd

Explanations about Options.-o(C): Mount the ISO: .  "sudo mount -o loop /path/to/iso /mnt/xxx". Create a new ISO from the directory: .  "mkisofs -o xyz.iso ~/xxx".
Explanations about Options.-o(M):
Use the specified mount options. The opts argument is a comma-separated list. For
 example:
Explanations about Options.-t(M):
The argument following the -t is used to indicate the filesystem type. The
 filesystem types which are currently supported depend on the running kernel. See
 /proc/filesystems and /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/kernel/fs for a complete list of the
 filesystems. The most common are ext2, ext3, ext4, xfs, btrfs, vfat, sysfs, proc,
 nfs and cifs.
